news.title: TERI, GCCA sign pact to accelerate sustainable development of cement & concrete sectors
news.para: ​Under the MoU, TERI will provide its domain expertise and knowledge to support GCCA India's work to achieve sustainability in the Indian cement and concrete sector, it said.

news.title: Chandigarh housing board's CEO clarifies rules on inspection during flat transfer
news.para: Garg further said that in cases where reports of violations(s) were available in the CHB record, the affidavits about non-violation are not accepted and fresh inspection is carried out by CHB officials.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh: Pace of building activity slows as sand reaches remain closed
news.para: With continuous floods in the Krishna river, all sand reaches in the district were closed. Officials dumped huge quantities of sand at stock points but opened Chevitikallu sand reach, which led to 132 trucks being washed away.

news.title: Chandigarh housing board to offer one-time settlement for building violations
news.para: The agenda is coming up for discussion in the next board meeting, which is likely to be held in the first week of September. The date of the meeting will be finalised by UT adviser Dharam Pal, who is also chairman of CHB.

news.title: Nagpur: 221 more buildings to face criminal case for ignoring fire safety
news.para: Now, the fire and emergency services department will send the list of violators to the district court to initiate filing of criminal cases against owners of these buildings. Assistant law officer (NMC) Ajay Mate told TOI that four cases have already been filed in the court.

news.title: Mumbai: Stop imposing administrators from outside, appeal housing societies
news.para: According to experts, even the law supports the same. If appointments are made from within the society itself then no administrator and registrar can act in connivance with contractors to earn kickbacks, they add.

news.title: SRA to embark on Mumbai slum survey six years after GIS mapping
news.para: A slum survey will be carried out afresh in Dharavi too, where the Dharavi Redevelopment Project has failed to take off in 17 years despite it being declared as a vital infrastructure project.

news.title: PAG extends $100 million debt to Kalpataru's two realty projects
news.para: One of these projects is a mixed-use development with residential and commercial components in Thane, while the other project is residential development in Mulund suburb of Mumbai. Both the developments including the first phase of Thane project have a total 1.8 million sq ft saleable area.

news.title: Gurugram: Illegal farmhouse colonies on DTCP radar, survey underway
news.para: “Along with ongoing drone survey of Aravali forest areas in Gurgaon, DTCP is conducting survey in Gairatpur Bas, Raisina, Kiranki and Bhogpur villages of Sohna tehsil to identify illegal farmhouse colonies,” a senior DTCP official said.

news.title: Bombay HC refuses bail to Deepak Kulkarni of DSK Developers; wife gets relief
news.para: Kulkarni and his wife were arrested on February 17, 2018, for allegedly duping over 32,000 investors to the tune of Rs 2,043 crore by not returning their fixed deposits or paying promised interest.

news.title: Government cuts non-development zone around Thane Creek Flamingo Sanctuary
news.para: This comes as a major relief to builders in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region as hundreds of construction projects would have been affected by the no-development rule.

news.title: Final chance to be given to Unitech buyers seeking refund to reconsider their decision: SC
news.para: ED in its report, filed in a sealed cover before the top court, said that it has attached properties worth Rs 650 crore of Unitech Ltd group in connection with the money laundering charges against it and others, out of which Rs 450 crore is recoverable.

news.title: NGT orders closure of brick kilns violating environmental norms in Mathura
news.para: The NGT noted that brick kilns in Mathura are operative throughout the year without any study of the assimilative air capacity of the area and without following the laid down siting criteria and without consents.

news.title: NGT to conduct audit of Uttar Pradesh-SEIAA to find out frequent blatant violations
news.para: The tribunal was hearing a plea filed by Saviour Park Apartment Owners Association against violation of environmental norms in setting up of a construction project - "Saviour Park" in Ghaziabad by Savfab Buildtech, without valid Environmental Clearance (EC) and without requisite safeguards.

news.title: Indiabulls Real Estate, Embassy Group arms seek NCLT nod for merger
news.para: In February, Indiabulls Real Estate had said that the proposed merger will create one of India's leading listed real estate development platforms, with launched and planned development area of 80.8 million square feet across 30 projects in all the leading cities in India.
